newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore HSFO to stay within range, directionless.
newsitem.headline: Singapore HSFO to stay within range, directionless.

text.p: High sulphur fuel oil prices on Monday were expected to stay steady amid directionless talks as Chinese demand appeared to be dwindling, traders said.
Cash 180-cst cargoes for loading in October were bid/asked at $115-$118 per tonne on Friday.
China currently has fewer enquiries as it has already purchased about three to four fuel oil cargoes for delivery in October over the past two weeks, a trader said.

Indications into South China market were heard at between $125 and $126 per tonne on a cost-and-freight (c-and-f) basis. Traders said increased supplies from Kuwait has placed a cap on any potential price rise while the usual supplies were expected from Iran, they said.
The major who was seen bidding for cargoes on Friday might bid again to cover its requirements for power utilities, traders said.
Some traders noted that the market has been very quiet in the past week as major players were not bidding or offering aggressively in the market.
October paper, was bid/asked at $115.25/116.00, little changed from Friday's quotes at $115.50/$116.00.
